org.opentcs.algorithms

Interface Scheduler


  • public interface Scheduler
    A Scheduler manages resources used by vehicles, preventing both collisions and deadlocks.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Claims a set of resources for a vehicle.

      Releases a set of resources allocated by a vehicle.

      Returns all resource allocations as a map of ResourceUser IDs to resources.

      Called by the dispatcher once it knows the new route of a vehicle.
      void setRouteIndex(ResourceUser user, int index)

    • Method Detail

      • setRoute

        void setRoute(ResourceUser user,
              Route route)
        Called by the dispatcher once it knows the new route of a vehicle.
        Parameters:
        user - The resource user for which the route is defined.
        route - The new/current route of the resource user.

      • setRouteIndex

        void setRouteIndex(ResourceUser user,
                   int index)
        Called by the vehicle controller whenever the vehicle has finished another step on its current route.
        Parameters:
        user - The resource user for which the position is updated.
        index - The index of the user's current position on its route.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the index is not a valid index for the vehicle's current route.

      • claim

        void claim(ResourceUser resourceUser,
           java.util.Set<TCSResource> resources)
        Claims a set of resources for a vehicle.
        Parameters:
        resourceUser - The ResourceUser claiming the resources.
        resources - The resources claimed.

      • allocate

        void allocate(ResourceUser resourceUser,
              java.util.Set<TCSResource> resources)
        Allocates a set of resources for a vehicle.
        Parameters:
        resourceUser - The ResourceUser requesting the resources.
        resources - The resources requested.

      • allocateNow

        void allocateNow(ResourceUser resourceUser,
                 java.util.Set<TCSResource> resources)
          throws ResourceAllocationException
        Informs the scheduler that a set of resources are to be allocated for the given ResourceUser immediately, i.e. without blocking.

        This method should only be called in urgent/emergency cases, for instance if a vehicle has been moved to a different point manually, which has to be reflected by resource allocation in the scheduler.

        This method does not block, which means that it's safe to call it synchronously.
        Parameters:
        resourceUser - The ResourceUser requesting the resources.
        resources - The resources requested.
        Throws:
        ResourceAllocationException - If it's impossible to allocate the given set of resources for the given ResourceUser.

      • free

        void free(ResourceUser resourceUser,
          java.util.Set<TCSResource> resources)
        Releases a set of resources allocated by a vehicle.
        Parameters:
        resourceUser - The ResourceUser releasing the resources.
        resources - The resources released. Any resources in the given set not allocated by the given ResourceUser are ignored.

      • unclaim

        void unclaim(ResourceUser resourceUser,
             java.util.Set<TCSResource> resources)
        Unclaims a set of resources claimed by a vehicle.
        Parameters:
        resourceUser - The ResourceUser unclaiming the resources.
        resources - The resources unclaimed.

      • getAllocations

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<TCSResource>> getAllocations()
        Returns all resource allocations as a map of ResourceUser IDs to resources.
        Returns:
        All resource allocations as a map of ResourceUser IDs to resources.
